column module

class column.Column(bounds, height)[source]

Bases: object

A column is a stack of pieces that are placed on the board. The column is responsible for keeping track of the pieces that are placed on it. It has the bounds of the triangle that it is placed on.

Variables:

  • column_stack (list) – A list of pieces that are placed on the column.

  • bounds (pygame.Rect) – The bounds of the triangle that the column is placed on.

  • height (int) – The height of the column.

is_clicked(mouse_pos)[source]

Checks if the column is clicked. :param mouse_pos: The position of the mouse. :type mouse_pos: tuple :return: True if the column is clicked, False otherwise. :rtype: bool

update_piece_bounds(column_index)[source]

Updates the bounds of the pieces that are placed on the column. :param column_index: The index of the column. :return: None
